result.execSummary:
The defendant Lloyshonda R C Gee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Use Anti-Theft Remover (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(h).
  • Retail Theft - Use Shielding Device (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Release for standard conditions if imposed.

May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

No Contact with co-defendants or stores listed in the criminal complaint. Complete high school equivelency. Work toward  obtaining and maintaining full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Defendant Lloyshonda R C Gee in court with attorney Matthew Edward Weil.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is in compliance with victim notification.  State presents sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weil makes statements to the Court.  Defendant makes statements to the Court.  

The Court Orders the Following count #2: 

90 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  STAYED

Term of Probation: 2 Years  CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE
COURT WILL ALLOW TRANSFER TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;	
No contact with co-defendants/stores listed in the criminal complaint.
Complete high school equivelency
Work toward Maintain/Obtain full time employment or school or both
